intro: Aphelexis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from lanceolate to ovate. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Aphelexis heterophylla is a hardy plant that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with full sun exposure.
